b.) 
    Let A and B be two sets. Determine which of the following statements are
    true and which are false. Prove each statement that is true and give a
    counter-example for each statement that is false.
    
    I.) Prove: $P(A\cup B)\subseteq P(A)\cup P(B)$
     $Suppose\ x\in P(A\cup B) \rightarrow P(A)\cup P(B)$
    $x\subseteq A\cup B = x \subseteq A\cup x\subseteq B $
    $x\in P(a)\cup x\in P(b)$
    $x\in P(A)\cup P(B)$
    $\therefore \text{ The statement is true}$
    
    II.) Prove: $P(A\cap B) = P(A)\cap P(B)$
    $A = \{1, 2, 3\},\ B = \{1, 2, 4\}$
    $A\cap B = \{1,\ 2\}$
    $P(A) =$ {{}, {1}, {2}, {3}, {1, 2}, {2, 3}, {1, 3}, {1, 2, 3}}
    $P(B) =$ {{}, {1}, {2}, {4}, {1, 2}, {2, 4}, {1, 4}, {1, 2, 4}}
    $P(A\cap B)=${{}, {1}, {2}, {1, 2}}
    $P(A) \cap P(B)=${{}, {1}, {2}, {1, 2}}
   $\therefore P(A \cap B) =P(A) \cap P(B) \text{ Which means this statement is true}$

c.) Let A and B be any two sets. Construct an algebraic proof to that:
$(A\cup \overline B) - B = (A - B) \cup \overline{B}$

$Assume\ x\in (A\cup \overline B) - B  $

$x\in (A\cup \overline B)\ and\ x\notin B$

$(x\in A\ or\ x\in\overline B)\ and\ x\notin B $

$(x\in A\ and\ x\notin B)\ or\ (x\in\overline B\ and\ x\notin B )$

$(x\in A\ and\ x\notin B)\ or\ x\in\overline B$

$\therefore (A - B)\cup\overline B$
